sense.name: assume to be true for the sake of argument
sense.examples: Suppose that you had a lot of money. What would you do? Let us suppose that function f is an n-variable Boolean function.

sense.name: consider probable or likely
sense.examples: Look at that sky. I suppose it will rain today. Scientists supposed that large dinosaurs lived in swamps. I suppose you have heard the news. Do you suppose that Gillian will mary him? Her new book is supposed to be very good. It is widely supposed that the minister will be forced to resign.

sense.name: require something as a precondition
sense.examples: Your plan supposes that there are enough presents to go around. Patience must suppose pain. (quote by Samuel Johnson) Investment of this kind supposes an increase in the company's profits this year.

sense.name: consider something as an annoyance or unwilling agreement
sense.examples: I suppose you're going to be late again! I suppose that you think that's funny. Well, I certainly don't! Uh... I suppose I can come with you to the dentist. I don't agree with it, but I suppose it's for the better.

sense.name: consider as a suggestion - for a polite question
sense.examples: I don't suppose you could lend me the $50, could you?
